data.event: The town was founded in 1883 when the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway railway line between Barstow and Needles was built.

event.title: was bypassed by the opening of Interstate 40 to the north in 1973

data.event: It was bypassed by the opening of Interstate 40 to the north in 1973, and lost traveler's business and resident population.
The remaining buildings were razed in 1991, leaving little trace of the town.

event.title: holds the record for the longest dry streak in United States history with 767 straight days

data.event: Bagdad holds the record for the longest dry streak in United States history with 767 straight days without rain, from October 3, 1912 to November 8, 1914.
